reviewText:
(Note that I have played hours of this game but steam stopped counting the play time once I press play on the launcher.) Fallout 3 is a phenomenal game and I highly recommend playing it for atleast a half hour. it's a pain to get it working on windows 7 and higher, but its worth it. If you know a lot about computers it should take around 10-15 minutes to get working but if you're a computer noob like me it should take around 30-45 minutes to get the game working with no crashes/graphical bugs.
Now, lets talk about the game as a whole.
Graphics yet outdated add something to it, the atmosphere of the weast land just goes with it.
The AI isn't the best but it doesn't hinder the experience much.
Bugs/glitches are common in the game but there more funny then anything, such as corpses spazzing out when you kill them. Some screen tearing here in there but nothing to bad, I don't think you would notice it.
There is a glitch with the radio that some might have that causes the radions audio to become choppy or studder but this can be fix.
Remember, this isn't like a cod game or some crap, this is a shooter that requires skill and smart thinking to get past even the most simple super mutant. This game will test you in the most epic of ways. Buy this game and be sucked into the greatest most deep game ever made.




FALLOUT 4 HYPE!!!!

reviewText: People of the wasteland listen! This game was NOT designed for windows 7 OR 8. unfortunatly i run on a windows 8 x64bit operating system so it was extremly difficult to get this game to run. If you do have windows 7 or 8 which most of you will, be ready to spend ALOT of time modding the games codeing and software to get it to work. There is a guide on how to do it here but it is not guaranteed to work.      http://steamcommunity.com/app/22370/discussions/0/864956555011164413/       I wish everyone the best of luck to get this game to run on your operating systems. & if im honest, if you have a PS3 or XBox360, i would recommend purchasing it on those before PC. PC is alot more fun with mods, console commands ECT, but consoles are guaranteed to run it. And also before you all blame the creators its not Bethesda's fault! We must remember this game was released in 2008 before windows 7 so it would have never been possible to update it to run properly for windows 7 or 8.

reviewText:
This game is Epic.

Of all the Post-Apocalyptic themed games that I've played so far, this one is BY FAR the best. The storyline is well crafted and played out, especially for an open world game. With a multitude of weapons, armor, and Items to keep you experimenting with, the customization of your character is limitless.
Graphics aren't top notch, which is understandable considering when this game was made, but the somehow aesthetically pleasing retro-futuristic art style makes up for it in full. Even with the stand-out storyline, the story is up to you, will you fght for the Enclave and eradicate mutants? Or will you side with the noble Brotherhood of Steel and help purify the waters of the wasteland? The choice is up to you.

reviewText:
My review for Fallout 3! (And my Pros/Cons)

PROS:
Hundreds of hours of epic gameplay in the Capital Wasteland!
With DLC's about 50+ hours at least (plus new perks, weapons, enemies, quests, and other stuff)
Varied terrain, enemies, weapons, quests, armor, perks, and other items
Crafting/repair system
Game that is open-world
Graphics are phenomenal for its time
Karma System

CONS:
After completing largely everything in the game its hard to play again (can get sick of playing too much)
Graphics need reworking (in my opinion)
Some weapons largely have no effect on enemies
Pistols in game need to be completely re-worked (e.g. sights, recoil, damage, animations sometimes)
Some quests are variations of each other
If you dont like large games you wont like this
Game might erase your save
There are certain enemy and graphics glitches that are known to happen

OVERALL: This game is revolutionary! I highly recommend this title to every gamer! Even though my CONS outweigh my PROS I still believe this game is still very good but with limited replay. 9/10

(Anyone who wants to friend me do so but I might reject your request)

reviewText:
Despite the lack of functionality for initial use, it is an absolutely wonderful game.

Pros
>nuke launchers
>all of the 2008 graphics gore
>♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ simulation
>desert hike simulation
>being nice simulation
>worthless scrap as currency(much realism)
>stealing the declaration of independence(such Nicolas Cage)
>being iron man in a retrofuturistic hell scape
>cannibalism
>being 10 again

Cons
>inability to kill everyone related to the story, rendering the game unplayable
>death orders being set when I am a good person
>1000s of unkillable mutants assaulting me as I do the story
>offering no obvious side quests early in the game
>murdering me if I follow the story right away

10/10 would(and have) play again

Fallout 3 is one of-No,the best game i've ever played! I could play this game again and again and again, and never get bored.

I full heartedly recommend this game to anyone who likes huge open world exploration,fun gamplay and epic main quest and side quests!

Word of warning however - If you are running windows 7 or later you will not be able to run this game by just buying and attempting to run the game,you wont be able to.... You'll have to look up guides on how to get the game to work with those versions of windows. A pain in the ♥♥♥ i know,but trust me if you've never played fallout before and you buy it now and go through the windows fix process it's so worth it!

And with Fallout 4 on the brink of release there has never been a better time to familiarise yourself with the Fallout universe!

11/10

reviewText:
This game is Epic.

Of all the Post-Apocalyptic themed games that I've played so far, this one is BY FAR the best. The storyline is well crafted and played out, especially for an open world game. With a multitude of weapons, armor, and Items to keep you experimenting with, the customization of your character is limitless.
Graphics aren't top notch, which is understandable considering when this game was made, but the somehow aesthetically pleasing retro-futuristic art style makes up for it in full. Even with the stand-out storyline, the story is up to you, will you fght for the Enclave and eradicate mutants? Or will you side with the noble Brotherhood of Steel and help purify the waters of the wasteland? The choice is up to you.

reviewText:
If you love a game with a post apocalyptic atmosphere, a good storyline, good graphics, and a pretty good AI, then this is the game you have been searching for.the game has a few technical issues, bugs, and not too good of player involvement, but that is common with Bethseda games, as they leave the little issues for moders to fix.

Overall, the games story is pretty dark, but throughout the story, I found myself having a laugh with the characters of the game. IF you liked Skyrim, this is a game you'll want, Fallout in general is a similar version of the elder scrolls, hust a deifferent story and environment.

the shooter part of the game isn't fantastic, but the story takes all the games issues and covers them with a layer of paint , and makes the paint job look very nice.

this game passes with a rating of 7.9, very good.

reviewText:
101/101 would vault again

Fallout 3 is an amazing game with incredible story that sticks with you forever.

Several hundreds years after the world destoyed itself with nuclear holocaust you emerge from a haven, only introduced into the hellish wastes of radioactivity and barbaric cultures who murder and steal for survival. You will do things that you regret, you will help the people who need it the most and you will survive, one way or another.

Choices matter here, you can murder people decimate communities or you can help fix the broken and worn out towns and ease the pain these poor souls must suffer from every day life. Someone upset you? bash their skull in with a hammer. Did someone take your teddy bear? blow their brains out. How about that ugly green mutant shooting hot lead at your face? MELT IT. You choose your skills, your weapon and your tactics. Be it melee weapons, guns, explosives, energy weapons or big ♥♥♥ versions of these, like say a minigun or laser equivalent. What about a gun that shoots nukes? The variety of traits and skills gives a different style each time you play. You can choose between light, medium and heavy armours that come with pros and cons along with stat changes.

Fast travel is a option if you want to move quickly from discovered locations. This gives incentive to explore more areas and gives you the ability to travel more freely between the large landscape. If you're truly hardcore, don't use it and just walk everywhere you go. (Not recommended for new players)

The trademark S.P.E.C.I.A.L (Strength, Perception, Endurance, Charisma, Intelligence, Agility and Luck) gives you the choice of adding points to each. Be a well rounded person, or dumb as a brick with super strength. Super smart and really slow and weak also work, but your big brain makes for a nice target, better add some points into luck to avoid getting headshot too often, or just sweet talk your way out of everything with a high charisma. If everything else fails, just take the bullets like they are your daily minerals.

I mean, if you don't like people you could always detonate an old war nuke..

Explore 200 year old vaults who have a secret and nasty history, with amazing and atmospheric story that makes you really think about the world you are in.

Like fast gameplay? Just do the main quest and forget about those perky side quests, or if you like a long and adventurous playthrough, explore the world and make a change to this hollow wasteland, for better or worse,
because war..

War never changes.

(I bet you didn't see that coming)

Personal Rating: 4.5/5

reviewText:
Sure the optimization is disapointing, but it is a quick fix and easy to find on YouTube. Beyond that matter though beholds an atmospheric, action packed journey. The mods enhance the game significently, but I  HIGHLY recommend playing the vanilla version throughly before putting your hands on mods; to fully experience the utmost example of an RPG. The action is fantastic, using an expansive arsenal of weapons and using VATS creates an interesting optional way to mow down your opponents. The expansive content the DLC's provide makes this game even more exquisite than it was, living it up to it's upmost potential (thankfully fixing the terrible ending). Character designing is iffy at best, does not provide a lot of breathing room (or creativity on that matter). Now the dialogue is fantastic and has humorous options that gives a charming trait to the game.  Therefore leading to the obvious conclusion which is BUY THE GAME. YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KXSUEU7ISfQ
FALLOUT 4 HYPE TRAIN

DISCLAIMER:
I have wasted my life to this game on console; I REGRET NOTHING.

reviewText:
This is one of the most grounbreaking games made around its time. Breaking free of the isometric stricly-third-person fallout 2: this game combines open world 'partial sandbox' with an RPG. Not to mention, there are so many side quests that the game itself doesnt get boring. You can choose which quests you want to accomplish. However, some have to be finished for the game to continue. The fighting system is glorious, fire with precision using VATS, or become a master with guns using the iron/sights. With many different ways to play this game, it will never get boring. My only complaint being that there is not a workshop for Fallout 3. Definitely worth your money.

reviewText:
Fallout 3 is a breath taking game that was unreal at its time. There are many aspects of this game that I liked and few i didnt like about the game.

I'll start off listing the positives:
+ Alot of game play to keep you busy for awhile!
+ Great Dialogue, alot of choices to choose your fate.
+ High replay value.
+ Dynamic leveling system to always keep the game fresh.
+ Modding Community will keep you busy for hours and hours.


Here are some negatives that come to mind:
- Games for Windows Live sucks.
- ALT+TAB crashes
- Problems with compatibility with newer OS's.
- Must buy Broken Steel DLC to extend the ending and to continue playing the game.

Overall this is a wonderful game and I strongly recommend it to anyone.
My Rating: ★★★★★

reviewText: Alright Fallout 3 is a great game, I have it on console and I love it. Wanted to take it on the go, downloaded it on steam, Fallout 3 is not optimized for Windows 7 and later" no problem its an easy fix.\n\nMy first problem: game won't launch
date: solution download this [http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=5549] it downloads windows live because this game is optimized for Windows Vista. You don't need to do anything with it
recommended: just install and you will have the necessary files to RUN fallout 3.\n\nMy second problem: when I try to start a new game the game crashes
hoursPlayed:
solution go here and download it   [https://www.dropbox.com/s/5ot8tm7szvlnuks/d3d9.dll]
Once you have the file downloaded put in the Fallout 3 folder.
1. Open program files(x86)
2. Steam
3. Steam apps
4. Common
5. Fallout 3 or Fallout 3 GOTY whichever one you have
Place the d3d9.ll file in the fallout 3 folder.

With that the game should be playable. If the game still crashes after trying to start a new game you can TRY this if you have a multi-cored processor. If you don't
voteText: I still recommend you try this\n1. Launch the game and go to the main menu.\n2. While it is running
helpfulPercent:
open the task manager and go to the details tab
3. Right click on Fallout3.exe and go to properties
4. Select compatibility and choose windows vista
5. Hit APPLY THEN OK
6. Right click on Fallout3.exe again and go to set affinity
7. Select 1 cpu not all of them.
8. Restart the game and it should work

Now if the game works but you are experiencing frequent crashes you can:
(WARNING THIS COULD DELETE SAVES I SUGGEST YOU GO TO Documents\My Games\Fallout3\Saves AND COPY AND PASTE ALL SAVES IN A DIFFERENT FOLDER OR ANYWHERE YOU FEEL IS EASY TO ACCESS)
1. Open up the Fallout.ini file in: Documents\My Games\Fallout3
2. Find the line: bUseThreadedAI=0 (you can use ctrl+f to find it faster)
3. Change it to: bUseThreadedAI=1
4. Add another line after it and insert: iNumHWThreads=2"

reviewText:
How to fix freezes/crashes on Windows 7 or above.

Go to documents/my games/Fallout3
Click FALLOUT.ini or just FALLOUT if the .ini isn't present.
Edit it with notepad or notepad++. Press control+F and type bUseThreadedAI"
It will say bUseThreadedAI=0
date:
change the 0 to a 1.
Press enter and type EXACTLY this: iNumHWThreads=2
Save the file.
Boot up Fallout 3
recommended:
than ALT+TAB out.
Open task manager and look for Fallout3.
Right click it and go to properties.
Up the top
voteText: select what operating system you have.\n\nI hope this helped!"

reviewText: This game is a masterpiece.  It took the RTS elements of the first two Fallout games, and blended them seamlessly into an fps.  Bethesda nailed it, and I'm very excited for Fallout 4.  My only complaints are that the game was VERY unstable, randomly crashing the first few times that I played it.  However, after running in compibility mode, and tweaking some config files, I got it running.  Also, the ending was somewhat anticlimatic,  but my character died a hero.  This game is on my top 10 list, and I reccomend it to any RPG/FPS fan.

reviewText: Fallout 3 comes highly recommended, both for fans of Bethesda's Elder Scrolls series and old school Fallout fans. Though it makes some serious changes to the gameplay formula, it still maintains the spirit of the original two classics. I've played this game for hundreds of hours on the PS3 (have the Platinum trophy for it), and this still managed to engross me, mostly due to the large amount of mods available for this game. Just about any complaint I have for this game can be fixed thanks to the highly dedicated modding community, which remains alive to this day, years after release. For such a low price, this is one hell of a deal, one that will give you plenty of bang for your buckshot.

reviewText:
Fallout 3 is a breath taking game that was unreal at its time. There are many aspects of this game that I liked and few i didnt like about the game.

I'll start off listing the positives:
+ Alot of game play to keep you busy for awhile!
+ Great Dialogue, alot of choices to choose your fate.
+ High replay value.
+ Dynamic leveling system to always keep the game fresh.
+ Modding Community will keep you busy for hours and hours.


Here are some negatives that come to mind:
- Games for Windows Live sucks.
- ALT+TAB crashes
- Problems with compatibility with newer OS's.
- Must buy Broken Steel DLC to extend the ending and to continue playing the game.

Overall this is a wonderful game and I strongly recommend it to anyone.
My Rating: ★★★★★

reviewText:
How to play Fallout 3 for beginners:
Step 1: Play for a few hours and make some progress
Step 2: Arrive to a difficult area
Step 3: Keep saying you're screwed until you kill everyone
Step 4: Crippled head. Having fun with concussion simulator
Step 5: Oh ♥♥♥♥, you missed one guy and you have 10 health
Step 6: Die
Step 7: Realize you haven't saved in an hour or two
Step 8: Exit Fallout 3
Step 9: Come back a few days later.
Step 10: Repeat steps 1-3
Step 11: Finally beat that one area.
Step 12: Save and quit
Step 13: Launch Fallout 3 when you are ready to play again.
Step 14: Repeat steps 1-14

Oblivion in a post apacolyptic wasteland.

Schematics" which can be found
recommended:
or earned for cooler weapons.

Cons:
Windows only; no Linux or Mac supports...yet.
Online multiplayer requires a Games for Windows account (but the single player is the real meat of Fallout 3 anyway)."

reviewText:
Fallout 3's plot summary.

Dad killed himself rather than let his broken machine fall into the hands of people trying to fix it. As a result, a water purifier that has no reason to exist released radiation it shouldn't have, thus killing Col Autumn, who had no reason to be there. Later we got through a villiage of children who fdso gah frrzlmpr blaa huygnnl asdf so we could enter vault 87 and recover a GECK, a device which would be better put to use in virtually any possible manner besides the one for which we had aquired it. Then Col Autumn, who shouldn't be alive, but is, captured us with a flash grenade that shouldn't have worked in a place he shouldn't have been able to reach, so he could stop us from fixing the machine he wanted fixed. He then tortured us for a code that didn't matter which we had no reason not to give him. Then, the president, which is a computer for absolutely no reason, set us free to enact his plan which was of benefit to absolutely no one, and then kills himself for no reason whatsoever.

At the final battle, everyone in the world has the same goal: Turn on the water purifier. Due to this overwhelming consensus, we were obliged to fight a massive war. Finally, Col Autumn gave his life to stop us from turning on the machine he was trying to turn on. At the end, the Enclave defeated themselves by sabotaging the machine they where trying to activate, causing it to explode even though it shouldn't, and obliging us to enter the purifier and die of radiation that wasn't actually lethal. At least until the DLC retconned our death, making everything Fawkes ever said to you a lie. A ghoul companion refused to enter the chamber, even though ghouls are healed by radiation.

It's a fun game otherwise.

reviewText: Easily one of the greatest games I have ever played. The game has a decent story, characters, and controls. The end of the main story line kinda sucks but once you get the dlcs you can play after main storyline is completed. Really worth it also. The gameplay length then becomes ridiculously immense. The replay value is very high. I've clocked in close to 300 hours on this game and in my second run through, I am still finding quests and areas that I hadn't the first time. If you like role-playing game elements, 1st person shooters, wide-open worlds for exploration, and a game with tons of side-quests, this game is for you.

reviewText:
Well, this is acutually one of my favorite games ever made. I love almost everything about it, and literally the only problem i had was getting it to start up. I dont have a gpu currently, and appearantly you need one to run it. So I had to download some stuff that made it think I did.

Gameplay is spectacular, but i found myself never using v.a.t.s on the pc as my mouse was much more reliable.

The game looks good, and doesnt take much to run at a decent fps. Its locked at 60fps, but im sure there's a work around.

Modding is the best thing ever and is actually why I bought the pc version. Modding also extends the life of this game so much, as the story can be finished rather fast.
I know its unrelated, but i recommend some snow mods, and fellout, to give the skys a more grey look instead of a green tint.

There is so much to explore and do, i recommend taking your first playthrough slow, and do whatever feels right, not what you think will get you through the mission. Its an RPG, get Immersed!

I would recommend this to anyone. I mean, its cheap, and its better than a lot of the new AAA titles out there.

reviewText:
NOTE: I don't enjoy the Fallout series, the only one that looks playable for me is Fallout 4 and thus my opinions will be somewhat negative.


Now, Fallout was originally owned by Interplay. It was originally a top-down exploration type thing. Not even joking. Bethesda then bought the series and developed this... thing. Most gamers will say they love the Fallout series, and thus the reason Fallout 4 is doing so well in sales (plus it's a really good game). Fallout 3 is Skyrim, with guns. Just really weird gunplay mechanics sadly. The story was actually quite good, despite the fact that I don't really like this game. I can't seem to get over it all.



tl;dr Fallout 3 isn't for me, but might be for you. (hence the yes" recommendation)"

reviewText:
if you have a multi core processor and the game dosen't work all you have to do is:
go to the search bar on windows and type msconfig
the go to boot and advanced options
tick the box that says number of processors and set it to one
restart your computer and it should work.
PS.if you want to play other games go back in to msconfig and un tick the number of processors box and restart your computer and it will use all your processors again.

reviewText: Music is great. Tunnel Snakes RULE!!!!!!!. If you like wandering around fighting off bandits or weapon wielding mutants. Steal everything in sight or at least try to.
